### A Simple pytorch implementation of GradCAM[1], and GradCAM++[2]

### Installation```shpip install pytorch-gradcam```### Supported torchvision models- alexnet- vgg- resnet- densenet- squeezenet### Usageplease refer to `example.ipynb` for general usage and refer to documentations of each layer-finding functions in `utils.py` if you want to know how to set `target_layer_name` properly.Use your own model and layer:```pythonmodel = MyModel()target_layer = model.my_submodulegradcam = GradCAM(model, target_layer)```### References:[1] Grad-CAM: Visual Explanations from Deep Networks via Gradient-based Localization, Selvaraju et al, ICCV, 2017
[2] Grad-CAM++: Generalized Gradient-based Visual Explanations for Deep Convolutional Networks, Chattopadhyay et al, WACV, 2018
